results.title: Paris la nuit
results.creator_credit: Jacques Baratier, Jean Valere, Argos Films and Como Films
results.brief_description: An impressionistic approach to documentary film production utilising a variety of striking images which at times suggest an almost surrealistic sense of humour. Jacques Baratier and Jean Valere have captured Paris nightlife in 1956 featuring its streets and inhabitants, cabarets, Chansonniers and other entertainments, its lights and edifices. As the night progresses, Parisians return to their homes and venues close as markets prepare to open. Excellent cinematography by Maurice Barry. A film without dialogue, incorporating songs in its soundtrack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Baratier, Jean Valere, Argos Films and Como Films

results.title: Parent teacher interviews
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, John Morris, South Australia. Dept. of Education and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five encounters which typify the difficulties in communication that often arise in parent-teacher interviews. 1. The Major by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Brian Victory. Parents: Julie Dawson, Leslie Dayman. - 2. Doctor Lawyer Indian Chief by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Julie Hamilton. Parents: Di Chamerlain, Alan Becher. - 3. A Stranger by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Paul Weingott. Parents: Carol Skinner, Ian Gray. - 4. A Matter of Motivation by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Colin Myers. Parents: Christine Martin-Murphy, Patrick Frost. - 5. Dear Miss Stevens by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Noni Hazelhurst. Mother: Mary Taylor.

results.title: Oxidation and reduction
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel, Max J Rosenberg and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the relationship and the differences between oxidation and reduction. Explains this type of reaction in terms of electron transfer. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Barry Corbet, Joern Gerdts, Robert Fulton, Roger C. Brown, Crystal Productions and Summit Films
results.brief_description: The benefits of the outward bound course, including increased autonomy and knowledge of people, and the psychological kick to be had from danger. Good photography and much use of music. This is not an instructional film.

results.title: Out of true
results.creator_credit: Philip Leacock and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description: The story of Molly Slade, a housewife with two children, who has a complete nervous breakdown due to overstrain, and attempts to commit suicide.

results.title: Othello
results.creator_credit: Stuart Burge, Anthony Havelock-Allan and John Brabourne
results.brief_description: National Theatre of Great Britain’s stage production of William Shakespeare’s play. Features Laurence Olivier, Maggie Smith, Derek Jacobi and Frank Finlay. Although the lighting is very dark at times making the action hard to discern, this dramatisation is very powerful and moving.

results.title: Openly in the city
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two different approaches to the problem of educating mentally handicapped children. The first is based on the premise that the children need guidance in personality development as well as basic educational skills, in order that they may gain an identity, and thus an idea of their place in society. The second approach involves perfecting certain skills through structured programs, in the belief that the individual will develop as he masters skills Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: An Open space secondary school at work
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how individual differences in students’ capacity to learn can in fact be used to benefit their intellectual growth. It gives an inside view of an Open Space School in operation, showing the advantages and day-to-day methods used in the Open Space School layout. Some of the problems which must be faced and solved by staff as well as students to promote an efficient and effective school are discussed.

results.title: On such a night
results.brief_description: A visit to Glyndebourne opera by a young American. Intrigued by a group of people in evening dress at Victoria Station, he follows them to Glyndebourne and learns of this centre of opera in an historic country house. Shows excerpts from a performance of Mozart’s The Marriage of Figaro with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.
